title: Make life simple. Studio weekly rates starting at $520.
description:
A budget-friendly extended stay hotel in Bethlehem, PA
We invite you to experience the conveniences of home at WoodSpring Suites® Allentown Bethlehem. Our all-suite hotel with in-room kitchens is the perfect choice for your extended stay, whether it’s for a week, a month, or longer. We offer low nightly, weekly, and monthly hotel rates to help save you money. Plus, you'll enjoy free WiFi, guest laundry facilities and free parking at our 100% smoke-free, pet-friendly property, making your stay simple and hassle-free.
You'll enjoy quick access to a variety of destinations and attractions when you stay at our hotel in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. If you’d like to take advantage of public transportation, we're right on the 108, 217, 319, and 327 local LANta bus routes, while the Amtrak Bus Station is just 6 miles away. We're about 8 miles from the Lehigh Valley International Airport/ABE Airport. $50 to $100 Deposit.
Hotel at a Glance
5 miles to Lehigh Valley Hospital Muhlenberg
6 miles to St. Luke’s Hospital Anderson Campus
6 miles to Greyhound and Amtrak stations
8 miles to Lehigh Valley International Airport
Nightly, weekly and monthly hotel rates
Full kitchen in every room
Guest Rooms
Visit our extended stay hotel and select the suite layout that meets your needs. Each layout features a combination of double-/full-sized beds and sleeper sofas, as well as a dresser, nightstand and shelves. All suites also include a kitchen with full-size refrigerator, stovetop, microwave, cupboards and prep sink. Sit back and relax during your stay while enjoying free WiFi and a flat-screen TV with cable/satellite and a premium movie channel. Every-other-week housekeeping services are provided for long-stay guests. Additional items—including a linen exchange, cookware, dishes, and more frequent housekeeping—are available for purchase at the front desk.
Explore activities for all ages in Allentown Bethlehem
You're in the heart of it all when you stay at WoodSpring Suites in Allentown Bethlehem, where you'll find a variety of exciting attractions and destinations. History buffs will enjoy visiting the nearby Pennsbury Manor, the reconstructed estate of William Penn, who founded the Pennsylvania colony. We're also an easy drive to a number of family friendly activities, including Crayola Experience, Dorney Park and Wildwater Kingdom, and Lehigh Valley Zoo. Artists and creative types will want to check out the Banana Factory Arts Center, a collection of galleries and arts programs partly housed in a former banana distribution warehouse, about 9 miles away.
Pet Policy
Service animals are welcome at no additional charge, must be registered at front desk. Limit 2 dogs, under 75 lbs. per room. No cats. Non-refundable pet fees, 50 USD a pet reg fee and 10 USD a pet per night charge for the duration of the stay.
Hotel Alert: Some hotel features and amenities may be modified or unavailable due to COVID-19. For more information, please call your hotel directly.
Amenities to help you stay awhile
WoodSpring Suites is an extended stay hotel with clean and comfortable rooms, and a professional, friendly staff that’s available to assist you 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Our 100% smoke-free hotel offers pet-friendly hotel rooms, free parking, guest laundry facilities and conveniently located vending machines. Daily, weekly and monthly hotel rates are available.

title: 1984.2 sq foot, 3 Bedroom, 3.5 Bathroom, Barnard & Adams st
description:
Built in 2016, I'm the original owner.
1,984.2 square foot, four story townhome.
Overview:
Bedroom/Bathroom:
* Master Bedroom:  ensuite bathroom, walk in shower, walk in closet
* Loft Bedroom: ensuite bathroom, entire top floor
* 3rd Bedroom: full bathroom
* half bathroom (vanity, sink, toilet) in the living area for guests
Kitchen:
* Gas range and oven
* microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator
* island countertop
Laundry:
* Large (7.4 cu foot) Kenmore Clothing washer and dryer
* Laundry is located on the 3rd floor with the master bedroom and 3rd bedroom
Parking:
* 2 car garage
* Extended driveway allows space for a third car
* Street parking is always available (except Thursday 8-9 am)
Proximity to town:
* 5 min walk to town
* Located at the intersection of Barnard and Adams street
* Closest bar is Mas; very nice spot for a rooftop beverage after work
Climate:
* Central air heating and cooling
Extras:
* Balcony that gets sun in the morning
* New carpet (installed April 7th, 2020)
* New flooring on the first floor (installed April 7th, 2020)
* Newly painted walls (tentative for April 25th)
At a high level, there are 3 bedrooms, each with a bathroom.  There is also a "powder room" (sink, toilet, but no shower) in the living room, for guests.  Two of the bedrooms have an ensuite bathroom.  The master bedroom's bathroom has a massive 5 foot vanity sink and walk in shower.  The master bedroom also has 2 closets (one is a walk in closet).  The "loft" is larger than the master bedroom; taking up the entire 4th floor.  The third bedroom is smaller; I normally would rent it out for $600 to $700 but, recently, converted it to an office while working remotely during covid.
I love to cook and haven't found a better kitchen.  The stove and range use natural gas.  The stove, range, microwave, and fridge are close enough to each other that it's a breeze to grab ingredients/equipment and move around.  Close proximity usually means less counterspace, however there is a 42inch by 38inch island that more than makes up for it.  I usually sprawl the cook book, cutting boards, and ingredients out across the island as needed.  The sink is a single, 30 inch wide, stainless steel bowl with a garbage disposal unit.  The garbage disposal is a badger model 5-84.  The sink features a Moen brand single handle pullout kitchen faucet (model 7545).  The faucet pulls out 36 inches (3 feet) and has 3 water pressure modes and a "pause" feature.  The pause feature is nice if you are filling up something like a spaghetti pots and you don't want to put the pot in a dirty sink.  You can leave the pot on the counter, turn on the water then "pause" the flow until the faucet is over the pot.  Small things are sometimes the best part.  If you'd like to picture the appliances, the dishwaser is a whirlpool WDF520PADM5, the stove/gas range is a GE model JGB660SEJ1SS, and the microwave is a GE model JNM3163RJ1SS.
The house uses natural gas.  The water heater, hvac unit, and stove/range use it.  I decided not to have the washer and dryer hooked up to natural gas because they wiggle around when in use.  I'd rather not deal with gas leaks.
There is a patio that gets sunlight in the morning.  The two sliding glass doors light up the living room and kitchen and make for a very nice morning.
In terms of parking, the garage has space for two cars and the extended driveway can fit another.  Depending on the time of year, I'd use the garage space for various hobbies and have friends/family use the street parking.  The street parking is ample and tickets are only issued on Thursday mornings (when the street sweeper drives through).
I just had new carpet installed on April 7th and have a painter coming the week of the 25th.
The trash and recycling is on Monday; they generally come around 8am.  There are two 96 gallon containers: one for recycling and one for trash.  Bulk item collection is the first Wednesday of each month.  One large household item allowed, excluding hazardous waste, covered electronics, construction debris, or metal appliances.  Additional collection can be arranged at a fee.
I know my direct neighbors personally, if there are noise issues I can call and talk to them.  The community is young adults and families.  I'd prefer to rent to someone who would fit in with the neighbors.
